caption:
This photograph captures a dynamic river scene accentuated by a natural and architectural backdrop. In the foreground, lush green foliage, including dense shrubs and slender leaves, frame the view, infusing a hint of vitality and freshness. The river itself is the focal point, coursing energetically through the scene. Captured with a slow shutter speed, the water appears as a soft, flowing blur, emphasizing its swift movement and the power of the current. 

On the right side of the river, there is an aged stone building, suggesting a historical or old-world setting. The building features small, rectangular windows and is constructed with exposed brick and stone, giving it a rustic charm. Against these windows, the interaction of light and shadow plays subtly, contributing to the building's texture and depth. 

A stone wall runs parallel to the river's edge, perhaps functioning as a retaining structure. This wall and the building together create a stark contrast between the manmade structures and the river's untamed force. The overall composition of the image, with its mix of natural beauty and old architecture, evokes a sense of timelessness and the enduring relationship between human habitats and natural landscapes.
title: Waste from the Weyerhaeuser mill is discharged into the Whitman River, which in turn flows into the nearby, and heavily polluted Nashua River.
